title: 15 Best Minimalist Bedding Picks, Vetted by AD (2025)
description: Expect more from your bedroom decor
author: Shoko Wanger
excerpt: We found the best minimalist bedding that delivers a little something extra for a bedroom. Shop our top picks to add a bit more to your bedroom decor
text: All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.Featured in this articleCozy SheetsQuince European Linen Sheet SetRead moreBest Duvet CoverBrooklinen Ribbed Matelasse Duvet SetRead moreA Refined SetBoll & Branch Signature Hemmed Sheet SetRead moreIf you’re well-versed on home tours, you’re likely familiar with how often a bedroom is described as a sanctuary. The best minimalist bedding can make this possible for a more understated space. For many, these hallowed quarters are a treasured landing place at the end of a long day, and an escape from the hectic world outside its walls. It’s no wonder then that minimalist bedroom designs are so popular, with their sparse layouts, neutral bedding, and soothing lack of busy-ness.But as we’ve written before, minimalism—which can certainly encompass all of these things—is not only about what isn’t present in a space. It’s also about the purpose and intentionality of what is. Here, we’ve listed 15 bedding essentials—think pillowcases and duvet covers, bed sheets and throw blankets—that help achieve that sought-after minimalist style, but also deliver on certain indispensable extras: high-quality materials, long-lasting functionality, and a pleasing absence of excess at no expense to personality.To streamline our list, all prices shown reflect queen-size picks.Cozy SheetsQuince European Linen Sheet SetAccording to Rushda Hakim, founder of New York–based Rushda Hakim Design, the foundation of any minimalist bedding set is high-quality sheets. An AD editor favorite, these breathable, flax linen fitted sheets, flat sheets, and pillowcases win points for garment-washed softness, ethical manufacturing, and a certain transportive breeziness. “I’ve been inspired by a Mediterranean-meets-minimalist aesthetic lately,” says senior commerce editor Nashia Baker, whose sheet set in Bordeaux helped achieve the look.Best Duvet CoverBrooklinen Ribbed Matelasse Duvet SetThis 100% cotton bed bundle includes a duvet cover and two shams in Brooklinen’s much-loved ribbed matelasse. The look: sumptuous and sublimely textured, sophisticated without a hint of showiness. Looking to complete the set? Easy: Add bed sheets and a duvet insert before you hit checkout.A Refined SetBoll & Branch Signature Hemmed Sheet SetWe named these no-fuss, organic cotton sheets as our top choice for those who prefer the lustrous, wrinkle-resistant properties of sateen. “The “extra-soft feel paired with the lovely, cooling properties make them feel like the luxury sheets that they are,” says commerce director Rachel Fletcher.Best ComforterBuffy Cloud ComforterHakim describes the ideal minimalist bedroom as “elevated yet cozy.” Add instant warmth with Buffy’s Cloud Comforter, an Internet-famous bestseller for good reason. The all-season style negates the need to purchase more than one comforter, and its hypoallergenic lyocell design—made to fit bed frames from twin to California king size—is fully machine washable.A Reliable PillowSaatva Latex PillowPart of leaning into minimalist style is investing, wherever possible, in well-made products that stand the test of time. Saatva’s highly-rated latex pillows, which are our personal favorites, provide a dream-worthy base for any long-lasting bedding set. (Its sleek, hotel-caliber good looks are just a bonus.)West Elm European Flax Linen Merrow Edge Duvet Cover and ShamsSomehow both seriously luxurious and utterly relaxed, this flax linen duvet cover and shams merge the material’s trademark rumbled look with a sophisticated edge, literally. We’re partial to the black-and-white combo for its ultra-unassuming, blink-and-you-miss-it charms.Brooklinen Classic Percale Core Sheet SetNoisy prints are unlikely to have a place in a minimalist home, but Brooklinen’s 270-thread-count sheet sets keep patterns quiet thanks to muted tones and unobtrusive motifs. Choose from swirling Oyster, Sunwashed Stripe, and Tandem Stripe bedding sets in premium long-staple cotton. “The texture of these is unreal,” says contributor Yelena Moroz Alpert. “It feels buttery soft like a sateen, but still crisp as percale cotton should be.”Dusen Dusen Check BeddingKnown for its punchy prints and bright, bold use of color, textiles brand Dusen Dusen may not immediately spring to mind in conversations about minimalist bedding. But lo and behold, this stonewashed cotton coverlet, in a white-and-sand-colored check, proves that even offbeat patterns can come across as understated when rendered in a gentle palette.Cultiver Repose Linen BedcoverThe work of interior design mastermind Colin King, this heavyweight linen cover was made to drape over the entirety of the bed—pillows included—for a clean, contoured look that needs no further adornment.Schoolhouse Popcorn Grid CoverletEmphasize coziness with Schoolhouse’s 100% cotton Popcorn Grid coverlet, whose tufted loops are sure to bring inviting softness and subtle texture to any minimalist bedroom design. Add matching shams to complete the look.Photo: Yelena Moroz AlpertPhoto: Yelena Moroz AlpertBoll & Branch Waffle Bed BlanketAmong our top picks for blankets available on Amazon, this oversized-but-lightweight layer is made from 100% organic long-staple cotton, comes in six soothing colors, and contributes an element of irresistible fluffiness (like a “cushy egg crate for your body,” says Alpert), sans frills.Jenni Kayne Alpaca Basketweave ThrowOur pick for this year’s most luxurious throw blanket is this alpaca basketweave design from Jenni Kayne. Draped at the foot of a minimalist bed, it adds coziness and refinement in equal measure. And it just may be the only one you’ll ever need: as commerce writer Julia Harrison reports, it’s “rendered all other blankets moot.”West Elm Reversible Contrast Bed BlanketThe design of this neutral blanket isn’t as simple as it looks: It’s reversible, so the tones of its checked pattern can be changed up for a fresh look when needed. What’s more, it’s soft, Oeko-Tex Standard 100 Certified, and sized to fit even the largest beds.The Citizenry Lola PillowThrow pillows are the cherry on top of any bed. This one pairs handwoven, cream-colored alpaca with charismatic details like a chunky loop and an asymmetrical pattern, providing minimalist bedrooms with a hint of pattern and texture, minus any visual chaos.Parachute Cloud Linen Puff Lumbar Pillow CoverA playful finishing touch to an otherwise pared-back bed, this whimsical take on a traditional lumbar pillow features rows of hand-stuffed puffs that beg to be touched. Made using organic cotton, its cushiony design catches the eye while a palette of restrained neutrals keeps the look low-key.
html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.

Featured in this article

If you’re well-versed on home tours, you’re likely familiar with how often a bedroom is described as a sanctuary. The best minimalist bedding can make this possible for a more understated space. For many, these hallowed quarters are a treasured landing place at the end of a long day, and an escape from the hectic world outside its walls. It’s no wonder then that minimalist bedroom designs are so popular, with their sparse layouts, neutral bedding, and soothing lack of busy-ness.

But as we’ve written before, minimalism—which can certainly encompass all of these things—is not only about what isn’t present in a space. It’s also about the purpose and intentionality of what is. Here, we’ve listed 15 bedding essentials—think pillowcases and duvet covers, bed sheets and throw blankets—that help achieve that sought-after minimalist style, but also deliver on certain indispensable extras: high-quality materials, long-lasting functionality, and a pleasing absence of excess at no expense to personality.

To streamline our list, all prices shown reflect queen-size picks.

Cozy Sheets

Quince European Linen Sheet Set

According to Rushda Hakim, founder of New York–based Rushda Hakim Design, the foundation of any minimalist bedding set is high-quality sheets. An AD editor favorite, these breathable, flax linen fitted sheets, flat sheets, and pillowcases win points for garment-washed softness, ethical manufacturing, and a certain transportive breeziness. “I’ve been inspired by a Mediterranean-meets-minimalist aesthetic lately,” says senior commerce editor Nashia Baker, whose sheet set in Bordeaux helped achieve the look.

Best Duvet Cover

Brooklinen Ribbed Matelasse Duvet Set

This 100% cotton bed bundle includes a duvet cover and two shams in Brooklinen’s much-loved ribbed matelasse. The look: sumptuous and sublimely textured, sophisticated without a hint of showiness. Looking to complete the set? Easy: Add bed sheets and a duvet insert before you hit checkout.

A Refined Set

Boll & Branch Signature Hemmed Sheet Set

We named these no-fuss, organic cotton sheets as our top choice for those who prefer the lustrous, wrinkle-resistant properties of sateen. “The “extra-soft feel paired with the lovely, cooling properties make them feel like the luxury sheets that they are,” says commerce director Rachel Fletcher.

Best Comforter

Buffy Cloud Comforter

Hakim describes the ideal minimalist bedroom as “elevated yet cozy.” Add instant warmth with Buffy’s Cloud Comforter, an Internet-famous bestseller for good reason. The all-season style negates the need to purchase more than one comforter, and its hypoallergenic lyocell design—made to fit bed frames from twin to California king size—is fully machine washable.

A Reliable Pillow

Saatva Latex Pillow

Part of leaning into minimalist style is investing, wherever possible, in well-made products that stand the test of time. Saatva’s highly-rated latex pillows, which are our personal favorites, provide a dream-worthy base for any long-lasting bedding set. (Its sleek, hotel-caliber good looks are just a bonus.)

West Elm European Flax Linen Merrow Edge Duvet Cover and Shams

Somehow both seriously luxurious and utterly relaxed, this flax linen duvet cover and shams merge the material’s trademark rumbled look with a sophisticated edge, literally. We’re partial to the black-and-white combo for its ultra-unassuming, blink-and-you-miss-it charms.

Brooklinen Classic Percale Core Sheet Set

Noisy prints are unlikely to have a place in a minimalist home, but Brooklinen’s 270-thread-count sheet sets keep patterns quiet thanks to muted tones and unobtrusive motifs. Choose from swirling Oyster, Sunwashed Stripe, and Tandem Stripe bedding sets in premium long-staple cotton. “The texture of these is unreal,” says contributor Yelena Moroz Alpert. “It feels buttery soft like a sateen, but still crisp as percale cotton should be.”

Dusen Dusen Check Bedding

Known for its punchy prints and bright, bold use of color, textiles brand Dusen Dusen may not immediately spring to mind in conversations about minimalist bedding. But lo and behold, this stonewashed cotton coverlet, in a white-and-sand-colored check, proves that even offbeat patterns can come across as understated when rendered in a gentle palette.

Cultiver Repose Linen Bedcover

The work of interior design mastermind Colin King, this heavyweight linen cover was made to drape over the entirety of the bed—pillows included—for a clean, contoured look that needs no further adornment.

Schoolhouse Popcorn Grid Coverlet

Emphasize coziness with Schoolhouse’s 100% cotton Popcorn Grid coverlet, whose tufted loops are sure to bring inviting softness and subtle texture to any minimalist bedroom design. Add matching shams to complete the look.

  • Photo: Yelena Moroz Alpert

  • Photo: Yelena Moroz Alpert

Boll & Branch Waffle Bed Blanket

Among our top picks for blankets available on Amazon, this oversized-but-lightweight layer is made from 100% organic long-staple cotton, comes in six soothing colors, and contributes an element of irresistible fluffiness (like a “cushy egg crate for your body,” says Alpert), sans frills.

Jenni Kayne Alpaca Basketweave Throw

Our pick for this year’s most luxurious throw blanket is this alpaca basketweave design from Jenni Kayne. Draped at the foot of a minimalist bed, it adds coziness and refinement in equal measure. And it just may be the only one you’ll ever need: as commerce writer Julia Harrison reports, it’s “rendered all other blankets moot.”

West Elm Reversible Contrast Bed Blanket

The design of this neutral blanket isn’t as simple as it looks: It’s reversible, so the tones of its checked pattern can be changed up for a fresh look when needed. What’s more, it’s soft, Oeko-Tex Standard 100 Certified, and sized to fit even the largest beds.

The Citizenry Lola Pillow

Throw pillows are the cherry on top of any bed. This one pairs handwoven, cream-colored alpaca with charismatic details like a chunky loop and an asymmetrical pattern, providing minimalist bedrooms with a hint of pattern and texture, minus any visual chaos.

Parachute Cloud Linen Puff Lumbar Pillow Cover

A playful finishing touch to an otherwise pared-back bed, this whimsical take on a traditional lumbar pillow features rows of hand-stuffed puffs that beg to be touched. Made using organic cotton, its cushiony design catches the eye while a palette of restrained neutrals keeps the look low-key.
